page.title: 12PADSTOW SEA CADET CORPS
page.content: Padstow Sea Cadets are moving into their new headquarters this year.The building cost Â£53,000 and we raised quite a bit ourselves through events such as Bingos,a Teddy Bear Stall and raffling a painting all last summer.We meet every Friday and learn all about seamanship, I like swimming and sailing best but I don't like cleaning the boats.We wear a uniform similar to the Royal Navy and we have to make sure it is well turned out for our inspection.The best Cadets each year win a week's trip on a large sailing- ship, putting all they have learnt to practical use.We compete against other Cadet Corps in various competitions including survival courses on Dartmoor and rowing.We are called T.S.St.Petroc after the saint from whom Padstow is named.We are one of the few groups privileged to fly the Blue Ensign.
